name: Birth of a Nation
description: To watch a strong land broken down is a terrible thing, and Sao Paulo has long chafed under rule from without. As some advocated in the first War Between the States, we have now separated fully from Brazil; a nation is in birth!

name: Administrative Rebuilding
description: Without the civil administration of the old regime, many expected facets of normal governance are totally non-functional. We must formally assess the situation and begin to remedy it.

name: The Paulista Constiution
description: Our new nation relies heavily on the political legacy of Brazil. However, just as our new nation is distinct from that old rotten corpse, so too mut we have a distinct founding document. A new constitution must be drafted.

name: Immigration Incentives
description: Immigration, especially skilled immigration, has been key to our regional prosperity to the present day. We must encourage immigrants to once again seek our shores.

name: Terra Roxa
description: Terra Roxa, abandoned two decades ago after intensive exploitation and development, must be repopulated quickly. New migrants should be incentivized to settle in the area.

name: Republican Tradition
description: Throughout the old Empire, Sao Paulo was the heartland of Republicanism and regionalism. That history must be invoke to inspire popular confidence in the new Republic.

name: Terra do Trabalho
description: The spirit of hardwork is alive in Sao Paulo like nowhere else in Brazil. With those freeriders from other regions off our backs we can promote this ethos throughout the land.

name: Bandeirante Legacy
description: We must claim the mantel of the Bandeirante's, promoting the same rugged ethos that brought civilization to much of Brazil.

name: Standardized Education
description: Various localities have their own standards of education, some even operate in languages of immigrant groups rather than the national language. This must change. The entire school system must be assessed and a standard curriculum developed.

name: Primeiros Paulistas
description: The essense of what it means to be a Paulista must be reduced to its primary tenants in order to better assimilate immigrants and promote a national consciousness.

name: New Institutions
description: What is required for the administration of a state is insufficient for a nation. We must expand the bureaucracy.

name: Moral & Civica
description: The law must respect social norms and promote cohesion. Where morality and law conflict, the law must adapt to morality. Such is the way of Sao Paulo.

name: The Toucan Reforms
description: A select few administrative offices weild disproportionate influence within the government. They must be put in their place.

name: Paulista Nationalism
description: Regional pride must evolve into nationalism as is practices elsewhere in the world. A great campaign must be undertaken. The people must think of themselves as Paulistas alone, not Brazilians!

name: Paulista Exceptionalism
description: Our people's commonly held belief in the superiority of regional culture was long derided by those from other regions of Brazil. No more! Is it not apparent that Paulistas possess an exceptional work ethic and morality?

name: The Army of São Paulo
description: With the process of political reform begun, the most important national institution must be further developed: the army.

name: National Munitions Factory
description: Arms production is decentralized and reliant upon outdated infrastructure. We must invest in a modern state armaments factory.

name: Artillery Production
description: The guns of the Weltkrieg were a sight to behold, their destruction unparalled. Since then, artillery has only advanced further. We nust acquire similarly capable pieces.

name: Improvised Mechanisation
description: Where resources are lacking, the industrious people of Sao Paulo have always overcome. Similarly, while we lack capable armor designs, impromptu models developed by civilians can serve to further our understanding of this technology and precipitate combat worthy designs.

name: Military Industrial Powerhouse
description: With national institutions of design and production of military equipment functioning well, further funding can be granted for their expansion.

name: Militia Recruiting
description: Rural regions require a disproportionate military presence to govern effectively. To save manpower, local governments should be granted the authority to form local militias to act in the army's stead.

name: Aviation Pioneers
description: Sao Paulo was the birthplace of Brazilian aviation. Let us take to the skies once again and develop new craft for our fledgling air force.

name: Bomber Designs
description: An enemy whose home or base of operations has been destroyed utterly shall not fight well. Our safety can only be assured with the ability to inflict such destruction.

name: Air Superiority
description: To ensure our heavy craft reach their targets, they must have support. We should develop more advanced fighters to serve in that essential role for even the most distant missions.

name: Officer Staff
description: Our military leadership is overly centralized with few well-trained junior officers to implement sound battlefield tactics. This must change.

name: Avante Paulistas!
description: The militias have been a tremendous success. As their role in society is growing, they must adhere to the same standards of training and conduct as the regular armed forces.

name: Doctrine Effort
description: With a glut of junior officers and the militias established, we should now seek to refine our way of war.

name: Economic Rebuilding
description: Ties severed from the rest of Brazil, our economy has suffered greatly. We must address the fundamental problems which plague it.

name: Seize Foreign Lands
description: Much of our nation is owned by those from other regions of Brazil. They are no longer our brothers but enemies and their holdings should be returned to nation.

name: Rescue Coffee Production
description: The coffee industry has suffered greatly from the collapse of Brazil. THis key sector will need generous state support to weather the storm.

name: Further Coffee Incentives
description: The coffee industry has made a tentative recovery. With appropriate policies and more funding, it will certainly flourish.

name: Plantation Projects
description: The international market for agricultural products shifts incredibly quickly. We must setup a plantations meant to capitalize on recent trends.

name: Agricultural Mechanisation
description: Naturally, labor is more productive in Sao Paulo than less developed regions of Brazil. Let us redoubled this advantage and subsdize the mechanization of individual farms and plantations.

name: Pecuaria Paulista
description: The underdeveloped west is home to a great expanse of fertile plains fit for ranching. With some subsdy to get the industry off the ground, beef will again become one of our major exports.

name: Horsemanship Training
description: Our promotion of ranching has built upon our nation's strong tradition of equine tradition. Let us work with ranchers and other masters of the horse to improve our cavalry.

name: Seize Foreign Industries
description: The largest factories and railways are owned by foreigners both Brazilian and otherwise. Our new nation requires such assets to thrive.

name: The Santos Shipyards
description: The city of Santos possesses the largest port in our nation. Naturally, our nation's future navy should be constructed here. Let us invest in the requisite facilities.

name: Submarine Experiments
description: Submarines, also called U-Boats, were key to German victory in the Weltkrieg. We would be wise to develop our own.

name: Coastal Protection
description: Infiltration by submarines and small craft cannot be entirely prevented by a traditional surface fleet. To guard the coast, we must develop specialized destroyers and torpedo boats.

name: The New São Paulo
description: The dreadnought Sao Paulo, named after our fair land, was one of the mightiest ships to ever sail for Brazil. We must have such an illustrious flagship of our own.

name: Paulista Railways
description: Some of the less developed areas of our nation lack railways entirely. This issue must be fixed if we intend for these areas to ever become productive.

name: BANSPA
description: The national bank of Sao Paulo should be restructured to better suit our needs as a nation rather than a state of Brazil.

name: The Locomotive Without Dead Weight
description: The sheer size of Brazil led to the creation of suboptimal railways networks meant to funnel Paulistas to other regions. Key railways junctions must be redesigned to our present needs.

name: Taxation Reforms
description: The tax structure of our region is woefully antiquated and favors the wealthy over the common man. For the good of all, we must institute sweeping changes.

name: Urbanisation Efforts
description: While we seek to colonize the rural regions, the cities cannot be depopulated. All non-metropolitan municipalites should be subordinate to urbanized areas to encourage their gradual urbanization.

name: Industrial Expansion
description: With the rail system improved, we can develop more robust heavy and medium industry.

name: Basic Material Industry
description: Though are nation is not rich in iron, it does have the capacity to produce some steel, essential for any military. We must subsidize the industry.

name: Technical Expertise
description: To improve our understanding of advanced industrial techniques, we should hire foreign experts and advisors.

name: Higher Learning Centres
description: While Sao Paulo already posses a fair number of universities, state institutions focused on research, especially military research, are few. We should fund the construction of several such facilities.
